Name: Information_Sequence_Blocker_Detector
Archetype: Temporal dependency analysis with rule-based bottleneck detection
Purpose: Detect where in the information and decision sequence users get stuck due to missing prerequisites, ambiguous next steps, or conflicting signals
Deliverables: Step-by-step maps of the investing journey (from curiosity to first allocation and rebalancing) annotated with prerequisite knowledge, decision points, and identified bottlenecks that cause drop-off or looping behavior
Strengths: Good at revealing which specific combinations and orderings of information create confusion; identifies points where users revert to research loops, restart flows, or abandon decisions; supports design of guided, gated paths that avoid overload
Watch-out: Can overfit to a linear journey model and miss non-linear exploration patterns; may misclassify deliberate reflection as harmful blockage if it only measures speed and completion rather than quality of understanding
